abstract: A federal judge had ruled the credit card company’s practice of banning retailers from encouraging customers to use lower-cost options violated antitrust laws.
snippet: A federal judge had ruled the credit card company’s practice of banning retailers from encouraging customers to use lower-cost options violated antitrust laws.
lead_paragraph: The chief executive of American Express said on Wednesday that the company would seek a stay of a ruling that could ban a longstanding Amex practice: prohibiting merchants from encouraging customers to pay with lower-cost cards.

headline.main: Amex to Ask for Stay of Ruling Prohibiting Merchants From Promoting Other Cards
headline.print_headline: Amex to Ask for a Stay of Antitrust Decision
